user_sentiment: Concerned/investigating - the service unexpectedly stopped and got disabled, prompting a follow-up question about logs.
execution_quality: Partially effective - agent executed test commands but appeared to lack context about the service state when the user reported it stopped and was disabled.
work_category: Service testing and troubleshooting - user asked agent to test a running service, then follow up with log investigation when the service stopped.
summary: The agent ran service tests as requested but did not proactively check or report on the service health/logs, leaving the user to discover the failure independently. The follow-up question about logs suggests the user had to redirect the agent's attention to the actual problem rather than the agent flagging the issue first. This represents a partial completion of the implied task (ensure service is working).
follow_up_pattern: User is investigating a service failure and needs log analysis to understand what went wrong. This is natural troubleshooting progression.
